Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water.\nIt runs across the land with gracefulness. This Pokémon has\nthe power to purify dirty water.
It feeds on soil. After it has eaten a large mountain,\nit falls asleep so it can grow.
Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and\nbecomes a pupa once it has finished eating the\nsurrounding soil.
Larvitar is born deep under the ground. To come up to the\nsurface, this Pokémon must eat its way through the soil above.\nUntil it does so, Larvitar cannot see its parents.
Larvitar is born deep under the ground. To come up to the\nsurface, this Pokémon must eat its way through the soil above.\nUntil it does so, Larvitar cannot see its parents.
Its body is as hard as bedrock. By venting\npressurized gas, it can launch itself like a rocket.
Its shell is as hard as sheet rock, and it is also very\nstrong. Its thrashing can topple a mountain.
Pupitar creates a gas inside its body that it compresses and\nforcefully ejects to propel itself like a jet. The body is very\ndurable—it avoids damage even if it hits solid steel.
Pupitar creates a gas inside its body that it compresses and\nforcefully ejects to propel itself like a jet. The body is very\ndurable—it avoids damage even if it hits solid steel.
In just one of its mighty hands, it has the power to\nmake the ground shake and mountains crumble.
If it rampages, it knocks down mountains and buries\nrivers. Maps must be redrawn afterward.
Tyranitar is so overwhelmingly powerful, it can bring down a\nwhole mountain to make its nest. This Pokémon wanders about\nin mountains seeking new opponents to fight.
Tyranitar is so overwhelmingly powerful, it can bring down a\nwhole mountain to make its nest. This Pokémon wanders about\nin mountains seeking new opponents to fight.
It sleeps in a deep-sea trench. If it flaps its wings,\nit is said to cause a 40-day storm.
It is said to be the guardian of the seas. It is\nrumored to have been seen on the night of a storm.
Lugia’s wings pack devastating power—a light fluttering of its\nwings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, this\nPokémon chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.
Lugia’s wings pack devastating power—a light fluttering of its\nwings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, this\nPokémon chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.
A legend says that its body glows in seven colors.\nA rainbow is said to form behind it when it flies.
It will reveal itself before a pure-hearted Trainer by\nshining its bright, rainbow-colored wings.

Ho-Oh’s feathers glow in seven colors depending on the angle
at which they are struck by light. These feathers are said to
bring happiness to the bearers. This Pokémon is said to live at
the foot of a rainbow.

Ho-Oh’s feathers glow in seven colors depending on the angle
at which they are struck by light. These feathers are said to
bring happiness to the bearers. This Pokémon is said to live at
the foot of a rainbow.
This Pokémon wanders across time. Grass and trees\nflourish in the forests in which it has appeared.
It has the power to travel across time, but it is said\nto appear only in peaceful times.
This Pokémon came from the future by crossing over time.\nIt is thought that so long as Celebi appears, a bright and\nshining future awaits us.
This Pokémon came from the future by crossing over time.\nIt is thought that so long as Celebi appears, a bright and\nshining future awaits us.
It quickly scales even vertical walls. It senses\nhumidity with its tail to predict the next\nday’s weather.
Small hooks on the bottom of its feet catch on\nwalls and ceilings. That is how it can hang\nfrom above.
Treecko has small hooks on the bottom of its feet that enable\nit to scale vertical walls. This Pokémon attacks by slamming\nfoes with its thick tail.
Treecko is cool, calm, and collected—it never panics under\nany situation. If a bigger foe were to glare at this Pokémon,\nit would glare right back without conceding an inch of ground.
Its strongly developed thigh muscles give it\nastounding agility and jumping performance.
It lives in dense jungles. While closing in on its\nprey, it leaps from branch to branch.
The leaves growing out of Grovyle’s body are convenient for\ncamouflaging it from enemies in the forest. This Pokémon is a\nmaster at climbing trees in jungles.
This Pokémon adeptly flies from branch to branch in trees.\nIn a forest, no Pokémon can ever hope to catch a fleeing\nGrovyle however fast they may be.
The leaves that grow on its arms can slice down\nthick trees. It is without peer in jungle combat.
It agilely leaps about the jungle and uses the sharp\nleaves on its arms to strike its prey.
The leaves growing on Sceptile’s body are very sharp edged.\nThis Pokémon is very agile—it leaps all over the branches of\ntrees and jumps on its foe from above or behind.
Sceptile has seeds growing on its back. They are said to be\nbursting with nutrients that revitalize trees. This Pokémon\nraises the trees in a forest with loving care.
It has a flame sac inside its belly that perpetually\nburns. It feels warm if it is hugged.
A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug.\nIt launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

Torchic sticks with its Trainer, following behind with
unsteady steps. This Pokémon breathes fire of over
1,800 degrees Fahrenheit, including fireballs that leave
the foe scorched black.
Torchic has a place inside its body where it keeps its flame.\nGive it a hug—it will be glowing with warmth. This Pokémon is\ncovered all over by a fluffy coat of down.
Its kicking mastery lets it loose 10 kicks per\nsecond. It emits sharp cries to intimidate foes.
During a battle, the hot flame in its body increases.\nIts kicks have outstanding destructive power.

Combusken toughens up its legs and thighs by running
through fields and mountains. This Pokémon’s legs possess
both speed and power, enabling it to dole out 10 kicks in
one second.
Combusken battles with the intensely hot flames it spews from\nits beak and with outstandingly destructive kicks. This\nPokémon’s cry is very loud and distracting.
It can clear a 30-story building in a leap.\nIts fiery punches scorch its foes.
When facing a tough foe, it looses flames from\nits wrists. Its powerful legs let it jump clear\nover buildings.
In battle, Blaziken blows out intense flames from its wrists and\nattacks foes courageously. The stronger the foe, the more\nintensely this Pokémon’s wrists burn.
Blaziken has incredibly strong legs—it can easily clear a\n30-story building in one leap. This Pokémon’s blazing punches\nleave its foes scorched and blackened.
Its large tail fin propels it through water with\npowerful acceleration. It is strong in spite of\nits size.
To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of\nwater. It has the strength to heft boulders.

The fin on Mudkip’s head acts as highly sensitive radar.
Using this fin to sense movements of water and air, this
Pokémon can determine what is taking place around it
without using its eyes.
In water, Mudkip breathes using the gills on its cheeks. If it is\nfaced with a tight situation in battle, this Pokémon will unleash\nits amazing power—it can crush rocks bigger than itself.
Its sturdy legs give it sure footing, even in mud.\nIt burrows into dirt to sleep.
Living on muddy ground that provides poor footing\nhas made its legs sturdy.
The surface of Marshtomp’s body is enveloped by a thin, sticky\nfilm that enables it to live on land. This Pokémon plays in mud\non beaches when the ocean tide is low.
Marshtomp is much faster at traveling through mud than it is at\nswimming. This Pokémon’s hindquarters exhibit obvious\ndevelopment, giving it the ability to walk on just its hind legs.
Its arms are hard as rock. With one swing, it can\nbreak a boulder into pieces.
It can swim while towing a large ship. It bashes\ndown foes with a swing of its thick arms.
Swampert is very strong. It has enough power to easily drag a\nboulder weighing more than a ton. This Pokémon also has\npowerful vision that lets it see even in murky water.
Swampert predicts storms by sensing subtle differences in the\nsounds of waves and tidal winds with its fins. If a storm is\napproaching, it piles up boulders to protect itself.
A Pokémon with a persistent nature, it chases its\nchosen prey until the prey becomes exhausted.
It has a very tenacious nature. Its acute sense of\nsmell lets it chase a chosen prey without ever\nlosing track.
At first sight, Poochyena takes a bite at anything that moves.\nThis Pokémon chases after prey until the victim becomes\nexhausted. However, it may turn tail if the prey strikes back.

Poochyena is an omnivore—it will eat anything. A distinguishing
feature is how large its fangs are compared to its body. This
Pokémon tries to intimidate its foes by making the hair on its
tail bristle out.
It will always obey the commands of a skilled\nTrainer. Its behavior arises from its living in packs\nin ancient times.
It chases down prey in a pack of around ten.\nThey defeat foes with perfectly\ncoordinated teamwork.
Mightyena gives obvious signals when it is preparing to attack.\nIt starts to growl deeply and then flattens its body.\nThis Pokémon will bite savagely with its sharply pointed fangs.
Mightyena travel and act as a pack in the wild. The memory\nof its life in the wild compels the Pokémon to obey only\nthose Trainers that it recognizes to possess superior skill.
It walks in zigzag fashion. It’s good at finding\nitems in the grass and even in the ground.
A Pokémon with abundant curiosity. It shows an\ninterest in everything, so it always zigzags.
Zigzagoon restlessly wanders everywhere at all times.\nThis Pokémon does so because it is very curious. It becomes\ninterested in anything that it happens to see.
The hair on Zigzagoon’s back is bristly. It rubs the hard back\nhair against trees to leave its territorial markings. This Pokémon\nmay play dead to fool foes in battle.
When running in a straight line, it can easily top\n60 miles an hour. It has a tough time with\ncurved roads.
It charges prey at speeds over 60 mph. However,\nbecause it can only run straight, it often fails.
Linoone always runs full speed and only in straight lines.\nIf facing an obstacle, it makes a right-angle turn to evade it.\nThis Pokémon is very challenged by gently curving roads.
When hunting, Linoone will make a beeline straight for the\nprey at a full run. While this Pokémon is capable of topping\n60 mph, it has to come to a screeching halt before it can turn.
It loves to eat leaves. If it is attacked by a Starly,\nit will defend itself with its spiked rear.
It lives among the tall grass and in forests. It repels\nattacks by raising up the spikes on its rear.

Using the spikes on its rear end, Wurmple peels the bark off
trees and feeds on the sap that oozes out. This Pokémon’s
feet are tipped with suction pads that allow it to cling to glass
without slipping.

Wurmple is targeted by Swellow as prey. This Pokémon
will try to resist by pointing the spikes on its rear at the
attacking predator. It will weaken the foe by leaking poison
from the spikes.
It wraps silk around the branches of a tree. It drinks\nrainwater on its silk while awaiting evolution.
It drinks dew that collects on its silk and waits for\nevolution. Its hard cocoon repels attacks.
Silcoon tethers itself to a tree branch using silk to keep from\nfalling. There, this Pokémon hangs quietly while it awaits\nevolution. It peers out of the silk cocoon through a small hole.

Silcoon was thought to endure hunger and not consume
anything before its evolution. However, it is now thought
that this Pokémon slakes its thirst by drinking rainwater
that collects on its silk.
Vibrantly patterned wings are its prominent feature.\nIt sucks sweet flower nectar with its long mouth.
It has an aggressive nature. It stabs prey with its\nlong, narrow mouth to drain the prey’s fluids.
Beautifly’s favorite food is the sweet pollen of flowers. If you\nwant to see this Pokémon, just leave a potted flower by an\nopen window. Beautifly is sure to come looking for pollen.
Beautifly has a long mouth like a coiled needle, which is very\nconvenient for collecting pollen from flowers. This Pokémon\nrides the spring winds as it flits around gathering pollen.
Its body, which is made of soft silk, hardens over\ntime. When cracks appear, evolution is near.
It never forgets any attack it endured while in the\ncocoon. After evolution, it seeks payback.

Cascoon makes its protective cocoon by wrapping its body
entirely with a fine silk from its mouth. Once the silk goes
around its body, it hardens. This Pokémon prepares for its
evolution inside the cocoon.

If it is attacked, Cascoon remains motionless however badly it
may be hurt. It does so because if it were to move, its body
would be weak upon evolution. This Pokémon will also not
forget the pain it endured.
A nocturnal Pokémon. Drawn by streetlights, they\nmessily eat the leaves of trees lining boulevards.
It violently flutters its wings to scatter toxic dust\nwhen attacked. It becomes active after sunset.
Dustox is instinctively drawn to light. Swarms of this Pokémon\nare attracted by the bright lights of cities, where they wreak\nhavoc by stripping the leaves off roadside trees for food.

When Dustox flaps its wings, a fine dust is scattered all over.
This dust is actually a powerful poison that will even make a
pro wrestler sick. This Pokémon searches for food using its
antennae like radar.
It looks like an aquatic plant and serves as a ferry\nto Pokémon that can’t swim.
It searches about for clean water. If it does not\ndrink water for too long, the leaf on its head wilts.
Lotad live in ponds and lakes, where they float on the surface.\nIt grows weak if its broad leaf dies. On rare occasions, this\nPokémon travels on land in search of clean water.

Lotad is said to have dwelled on land before. However, this
Pokémon is thought to have returned to water because the
leaf on its head grew large and heavy. It now lives by floating
atop the water.
It lives at the water’s edge where it is sunny.\nIt sleeps on a bed of water-grass by day and\nbecomes active at night.
It has a mischievous spirit. If it spots an angler,\nit will tug on the fishing line to interfere.

Lombre is nocturnal—it will get active after dusk.
It is also a mischief maker. When this Pokémon
spots anglers, it tugs on their fishing lines from
beneath the surface and enjoys their consternation.
Lombre’s entire body is covered by a slippery, slimy film.\nIt feels horribly unpleasant to be touched by this Pokémon’s\nhands. Lombre is often mistaken for a human child.
If it hears festive music, all its muscles fill with\nenergy. It can’t help breaking out into a dance.
The rhythm of bright, festive music activates\nLudicolo’s cells, making it more powerful.
Ludicolo begins dancing as soon as it hears cheerful,\nfestive music. This Pokémon is said to appear when it\nhears the singing of children on hiking outings.

Upon hearing an upbeat and cheerful rhythm, the cells in
Ludicolo’s body become very energetic and active. Even
in battle, this Pokémon will exhibit an amazing amount
of power.
It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of\nits head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.
When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just\nlike an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.

Seedot attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its
head. It sucks moisture from the tree while hanging off the
branch. The more water it drinks, the glossier this Pokémon’s
body becomes.
Seedot looks exactly like an acorn when it is dangling from a\ntree branch. It startles other Pokémon by suddenly moving.\nThis Pokémon polishes its body once a day using leaves.
The sound of its grass flute makes its listeners\nuneasy. It lives deep in forests.
It lives deep in forests. With the leaf on its head,\nit makes a flute whose song makes\nlisteners uneasy.
Nuzleaf live in densely overgrown forests. They occasionally\nventure out of the forest to startle people. This Pokémon\ndislikes having its long nose pinched.
This Pokémon pulls out the leaf on its head and makes a flute\nwith it. The sound of Nuzleaf’s flute strikes fear and uncertainty\nin the hearts of people lost in a forest.
A Pokémon that was feared as a forest guardian.\nIt can read the foe’s mind and take\npreemptive action.
By flapping its leafy fan, it can whip up gusts of\n100 feet per second that can level houses.
Shiftry is a mysterious Pokémon that is said to live atop\ntowering trees dating back over a thousand years. It creates\nterrific windstorms with the fans it holds.

Shiftry’s large fans generate awesome gusts of wind at a
speed close to 100 feet per second. The whipped-up wind
blows anything away. This Pokémon chooses to live quietly
deep in forests.
It has a gutsy spirit that makes it bravely take on\ntough foes. It flies in search of warm climates.
It dislikes cold seasons. They migrate to other\nlands in search of warmth, flying over 180 miles\na day.

Taillow courageously stands its ground against foes, however
strong they may be. This gutsy Pokémon will remain defiant
even after a loss. On the other hand, it cries loudly if it
becomes hungry.
Taillow is young—it has only just left its nest. As a result,\nit sometimes becomes lonesome and cries at night.\nThis Pokémon feeds on Wurmple that live in forests.
If its two tail feathers are standing at attention, it is\nproof of good health. It soars elegantly in the sky.
It dives at a steep angle as soon as it spots its\nprey. It catches its prey with sharp claws.

Swellow flies high above our heads, making graceful arcs
in the sky. This Pokémon dives at a steep angle as soon as
it spots its prey. The hapless prey is tightly grasped by
Swellow’s clawed feet, preventing escape.
Swellow is very conscientious about the upkeep of its glossy\nwings. Once two Swellow are gathered, they diligently take\ncare of cleaning each other’s wings.
Catching sea winds with its long wings, it soars\nas if it were a glider. It folds its wings to rest.
It makes its nest on steep sea cliffs.\nRiding updrafts, it soars to great heights.
Wingull has the habit of carrying prey and valuables in its beak\nand hiding them in all sorts of locations. This Pokémon rides\nthe winds and flies as if it were skating across the sky.
Wingull rides updrafts rising from the sea by extending its long\nand narrow wings to glide. This Pokémon’s long beak is useful\nfor catching prey.
It dips its large bill in the sea, then scoops up\nnumerous prey along with water.
It is a messenger of the skies, carrying small\nPokémon and eggs to safety in its bill.
Pelipper is a flying transporter that carries small Pokémon and\neggs inside its massive bill. This Pokémon builds its nest on\nsteep cliffs facing the sea.
Pelipper searches for food while in flight by skimming the wave\ntops. This Pokémon dips its large bill in the sea to scoop up\nfood, then swallows everything in one big gulp.
If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or\nPokémon, its body warms up slightly.
It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and\nPokémon. It hides if it senses hostility.

Ralts senses the emotions of people using the horns on
its head. This Pokémon rarely appears before people.
But when it does, it draws closer if it senses that the person
has a positive disposition.
Ralts has the ability to sense the emotions of people. If its\nTrainer is in a cheerful mood, this Pokémon grows cheerful\nand joyous in the same way.
The cheerful spirit of its Trainer gives it energy for\nits psychokinetic power. It spins and dances\nwhen happy.
It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the\nspace around it and see into the future.
It is said that a Kirlia that is exposed to the positive emotions\nof its Trainer grows beautiful. This Pokémon controls\npsychokinetic powers with its highly developed brain.
Kirlia uses the horns on its head to amplify its psychokinetic\npower. When the Pokémon uses its power, the air around it\nbecomes distorted, creating mirages of nonexistent scenery.
To protect its Trainer, it will expend all its psychic\npower to create a small black hole.
It has the power to predict the future. Its power\npeaks when it is protecting its Trainer.
Gardevoir has the ability to read the future. If it senses\nimpending danger to its Trainer, this Pokémon is said\nto unleash its psychokinetic energy at full power.
Gardevoir has the psychokinetic power to distort the\ndimensions and create a small black hole. This Pokémon\nwill try to protect its Trainer even at the risk of its own life.
They usually live on ponds, but after an evening\nshower, they may appear on puddles in towns.
It appears as if it is skating on water. It draws prey\nwith a sweet scent from the tip of its head.
From the tips of its feet, Surskit secretes an oil that enables it\nto walk on water as if it were skating. This Pokémon feeds on\nmicroscopic organisms in ponds and lakes.
If Surskit senses danger, it secretes a thick, sugary syrup from\nthe tip of its head. There are some Pokémon that love eating\nthis syrup.
Its antennae have eye patterns on them. Its four\nwings enable it to hover and fly in any direction.
It flaps its four wings to hover and fly freely in any\ndirection--to and fro and sideways.

Masquerain intimidates enemies with the eyelike patterns
on its antennas. This Pokémon flaps its four wings to freely fly
in any direction—even sideways and backwards—as if it were
a helicopter.
Masquerain’s antennas have eyelike patterns that usually\ngive it an angry look. If the “eyes” are droopy and appear sad,\nit is said to be a sign that a heavy rainfall is on its way.
It prefers damp places. By day it remains still in\nthe forest shade. It releases toxic powder from\nits head.
It spouts poison spores from the top of its head.\nThese spores cause pain all over if inhaled.

Shroomish live in damp soil in the dark depths of forests.
They are often found keeping still under fallen leaves.
This Pokémon feeds on compost that is made up of fallen,
rotted leaves.
If Shroomish senses danger, it shakes its body and scatters\nspores from the top of its head. This Pokémon’s spores are\nso toxic, they make trees and weeds wilt.
Its short arms stretch when it throws punches. Its\ntechnique is equal to that of pro boxers.
It scatters poisonous spores and throws powerful\npunches while its foe is hampered by\ninhaled spores.
Breloom closes in on its foe with light and sprightly footwork,\nthen throws punches with its stretchy arms. This Pokémon’s\nfighting technique puts boxers to shame.
The seeds ringing Breloom’s tail are made of hardened toxic\nspores. It is horrible to eat the seeds. Just taking a bite of this\nPokémon’s seed will cause your stomach to rumble.
The way Slakoth lolls around makes anyone who\nwatches it feel like doing the same.
If it eats just three leaves in a day, it is satisfied.\nOther than that, it sleeps for 20 hours a day.
Slakoth lolls around for over 20 hours every day. Because it\nmoves so little, it does not need much food. This Pokémon’s\nsole daily meal consists of just three leaves.
Slakoth’s heart beats just once a minute. Whatever happens,\nit is content to loaf around motionless. It is rare to see this\nPokémon in motion.
Its heartbeat is fast and its blood so agitated that\nit can’t sit still for one second.
Its stress level rises if it cannot keep moving\nconstantly. Too much stress makes it feel sick.

Vigoroth is always itching and agitated to go on a wild
rampage. It simply can’t tolerate sitting still for even
a minute. This Pokémon’s stress level rises if it can’t
be moving constantly.

Vigoroth is simply incapable of remaining still. Even when it
tries to sleep, the blood in its veins grows agitated, compelling
this Pokémon to run wild throughout the jungle before it can
settle down.
The world’s laziest Pokémon. It moves to another\nspot when there’s no food left within its reach.
It is the world’s most slothful Pokémon. However,\nit can exert horrifying power by releasing pent-up\nenergy all at once.
Slaking spends all day lying down and lolling about. It eats\ngrass growing within its reach. If it eats all the grass it can\nreach, this Pokémon reluctantly moves to another spot.
Wherever Slaking live, rings of over a yard in diameter appear\nin grassy fields. They are made by the Pokémon as it eats all\nthe grass within reach while lying prone on the ground.
Because it lived almost entirely underground, it is\nnearly blind. It uses its antennae instead.
It can sometimes live underground for more than\n10 years. It absorbs nutrients from the roots\nof trees.
Nincada lives underground for many years in complete\ndarkness. This Pokémon absorbs nutrients from the roots of\ntrees. It stays motionless as it waits for evolution.
Nincada lives underground. It uses its sharp claws to carve the\nroots of trees and absorb moisture and nutrients.\nThis Pokémon can’t withstand bright sunlight so avoids it.
Its cry leaves a lasting headache if heard for too\nlong. It moves so quickly that it is almost invisible.
Because it moves so quickly, it sometimes becomes\nunseeable. It congregates around tree sap.

Ninjask moves around at such a high speed that it
cannot be seen, even while its crying can be clearly heard.
For that reason, this Pokémon was long believed to
be invisible.

If Ninjask is not trained properly, it will refuse to obey
the Trainer and cry loudly continuously. Because of this
quality, this Pokémon is said to be one that puts the
Trainer’s abilities to the test.
A discarded bug shell that came to life. Peering into\nthe crack on its back is said to steal one’s spirit.
A most peculiar Pokémon that somehow appears in\na Poké Ball when a Nincada evolves.

Shedinja’s hard body doesn’t move—not even a twitch. In fact,
its body appears to be merely a hollow shell. It is believed that
this Pokémon will steal the spirit of anyone peering into its
hollow body from its back.
Shedinja is a peculiar Pokémon. It seems to appear unsought\nin a Poké Ball after a Nincada evolves. This bizarre Pokémon\nis entirely immobile—it doesn’t even breathe.
It usually murmurs but starts crying\nloudly if it senses danger. It stops\nwhen its ear covers are shut.
If it senses danger, it scares the foe by crying out\nwith the volume of a jet-plane engine.
Normally, Whismur’s voice is very quiet—it is barely audible\neven if one is paying close attention. However, if this Pokémon\nsenses danger, it starts crying at an earsplitting volume.
Whismur is very timid. If it starts to cry loudly, it becomes\nstartled by its own crying and cries even harder. When it finally\nstops crying, the Pokémon goes to sleep, all tired out.
It shouts loudly by inhaling air, and then uses its\nwell-developed stomach muscles to exhale.
The shock waves from its cries can tip over trucks.\nIt stamps its feet to power up.
Loudred’s bellowing can completely decimate a wood-frame\nhouse. It uses its voice to punish its foes. This Pokémon’s\nround ears serve as loudspeakers.
Loudred shouts while stamping its feet. After it finishes\nshouting, this Pokémon becomes incapable of hearing\nanything for a while. This is considered to be a weak point.
Its howls can be heard over six miles away. It emits\nall sorts of noises from the ports on its body.
Its roar in battle shakes the ground like a\ntremor--or like an earthquake has struck.

Exploud triggers earthquakes with the tremors it creates
by bellowing. If this Pokémon violently inhales from the
ports on its body, it’s a sign that it is preparing to let loose
a huge bellow.
Exploud communicates its feelings to the others by emitting\nwhistle-like sounds from the tubes on its body. This Pokémon\nonly raises its voice when it is in battle.
It toughens up by slamming into thick trees over\nand over. It gains a sturdy body and\ndauntless spirit.
It grows stronger by enduring harsh training. It is a\ngutsy Pokémon that can withstand any attack.

Makuhita is tenacious—it will keep getting up and attacking
its foe however many times it is knocked down. Every time it
gets back up, this Pokémon stores more energy in its body
for evolving.

Makuhita has a tireless spirit—it will never give up hope.
It eats a lot of food, gets plenty of sleep, and it trains very
rigorously. By living that way, this Pokémon packs its body
with energy.
It stomps on the ground to build power. It can send\na 10-ton truck flying with a straight-arm punch.
It loves to match power with big-bodied Pokémon.\nIt can knock a truck flying with its arm thrusts.
Hariyama practices its straight-arm slaps in any number of\nlocations. One hit of this Pokémon’s powerful, openhanded,\nstraight-arm punches could snap a telephone pole in two.
Hariyama’s thick body may appear fat, but it is actually a hunk\nof solid muscle. If this Pokémon bears down and tightens all its\nmuscles, its body becomes as hard as a rock.
A Pokémon that lives by water. It moves quickly on\nland by bouncing on its big tail.
It swings its large, nutrient-filled tail around to fight\nopponents bigger than itself.

Azurill spins its tail as if it were a lasso, then hurls it far.
The momentum of the throw sends its body flying, too.
Using this unique action, one of these Pokémon managed to
hurl itself a record 33 feet.
Azurill’s tail is large and bouncy. It is packed full of the\nnutrients this Pokémon needs to grow. Azurill can be seen\nbouncing and playing on its big, rubbery tail.
Its magnetic nose always faces north and draws\niron objects to its body to protect itself better.
Its magnetic nose consistently faces north.\nTravelers check Nosepass to get their bearings.

Nosepass’s magnetic nose is always pointed to the north.
If two of these Pokémon meet, they cannot turn their faces to
each other when they are close because their magnetic noses
repel one another.

Nosepass had been said to be completely unmoving, with its
magnetic nose pointed due north. However, close observation
has revealed that the Pokémon actually moves by a little over
3/8 of an inch every year.
It can’t stop itself from chasing moving things,\nand it runs in a circle, chasing its own tail.
It shows its cute side by chasing its own tail\nuntil it gets dizzy.
Skitty has the habit of becoming fascinated by moving objects\nand chasing them around. This Pokémon is known to chase\nafter its own tail and become dizzy.
Skitty is known to chase around playfully after its own tail.\nIn the wild, this Pokémon lives in holes in the trees of forests.\nIt is very popular as a pet because of its adorable looks.
It dislikes dirty places. It often searches for a\ncomfortable place in which to groom itself.
It is highly popular among female Trainers for its\nsublime fur. It does not keep a nest.

Delcatty prefers to live an unfettered existence in which it can
do as it pleases at its own pace. Because this Pokémon eats
and sleeps whenever it decides, its daily routines are
completely random.
Delcatty sleeps anywhere it wants without keeping a permanent\nnest. If other Pokémon approach it as it sleeps, this Pokémon\nwill never fight—it will just move away somewhere else.
It hides in the darkness of caves. Its diet of gems\nhas transformed its eyes into gemstones.
It dwells in the darkness of caves. It uses its sharp\nclaws to dig up gems to nourish itself.

Sableye lead quiet lives deep inside caverns.
They are feared, however, because these Pokémon are
thought to steal the spirits of people when their eyes burn
with a sinister glow in the darkness.
Sableye digs the ground with sharpened claws to find rocks\nthat it eats. Substances in the eaten rocks crystallize and rise\nup to the Pokémon’s body surface.
It uses its docile-looking face to lull foes into\ncomplacency, then bites with its huge,\nrelentless jaws.
Attached to its head is a huge set of jaws formed\nby horns. It can chew through iron beams.

Mawile’s huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been
transformed. Its docile-looking face serves to lull its foe into
letting down its guard. When the foe least expects it, Mawile
chomps it with its gaping jaws.

Don’t be taken in by this Pokémon’s cute face—it’s very
dangerous. Mawile fools the foe into letting down its guard,
then chomps down with its massive jaws. The steel jaws are
really horns that have been transformed.
It usually lives deep in mountains. However, hunger\nmay drive it to eat railroad tracks and cars.
When it evolves, it sheds the steel carapace that\ncovered its whole body and develops a new one.
This Pokémon has a body of steel. To make its body, Aron\nfeeds on iron ore that it digs from mountains. Occasionally,\nit causes major trouble by eating bridges and rails.

Aron has a body of steel. With one all-out charge, this
Pokémon can demolish even a heavy dump truck.
The destroyed dump truck then becomes a handy meal
for the Pokémon.
It loves iron ore. Groups of them fight for territory\nby bashing one another with their steel bodies.
It habitually shows off its strength with the size of\nsparks it creates by ramming its steel body\ninto boulders.
Lairon tempers its steel body by drinking highly nutritious\nmineral springwater until it is bloated. This Pokémon makes its\nnest close to springs of delicious water.
Lairon feeds on iron contained in rocks and water. It makes\nits nest on mountains where iron ore is buried. As a result,\nthe Pokémon often clashes with humans mining the iron ore.
It claims an entire mountain as its own.\nThe more wounds it has, the more it has battled,\nso don’t take it lightly.
While seeking iron for food, it digs tunnels by\nbreaking through bedrock with its steel horns.
Aggron claims an entire mountain as its own territory.\nIt mercilessly beats up anything that violates its environment.\nThis Pokémon vigilantly patrols its territory at all times.

Aggron is protective of its environment. If its mountain is
ravaged by a landslide or a fire, this Pokémon will haul
topsoil to the area, plant trees, and beautifully restore its
own territory.
It always trains deep in mountains. It levitates\nwhen it heightens its spiritual power\nthrough meditation.
It eats just one berry a day. By enduring hunger,\nits spirit is tempered and made sharper.

Meditite undertakes rigorous mental training deep in the
mountains. However, whenever it meditates, this Pokémon
always loses its concentration and focus. As a result,
its training never ends.
Meditite heightens its inner energy through meditation.\nIt survives on just one berry a day. Minimal eating is another\naspect of this Pokémon’s training.
It elegantly avoids attacks with dance-like steps,\nthen launches a devastating blow in the\nsame motion.
Through yoga training, it gained the psychic power\nto predict its foe’s next move.
It is said that through meditation, Medicham heightens energy\ninside its body and sharpens its sixth sense. This Pokémon\nhides its presence by merging itself with fields and mountains.

Through the power of meditation, Medicham developed its
sixth sense. It gained the ability to use psychokinetic powers.
This Pokémon is known to meditate for a whole month
without eating.
Using electricity stored in its fur, it stimulates its\nmuscles to heighten its reaction speed.
It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging.\nIt gives off sparks if a storm approaches.
Electrike stores electricity in its long body hair. This Pokémon\nstimulates its leg muscles with electric charges. These jolts of\npower give its legs explosive acceleration performance.
Electrike runs faster than the human eye can follow.\nThe friction from running is converted into electricity,\nwhich is then stored in this Pokémon’s fur.
It rarely appears before people. It is said to nest\nwhere lightning has fallen.
It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a\nthundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.
Manectric is constantly discharging electricity from its mane.\nThe sparks sometimes ignite forest fires. When it enters a\nbattle, this Pokémon creates thunderclouds.
Manectric discharges strong electricity from its mane.\nThe mane is used for collecting electricity in the atmosphere.\nThis Pokémon creates thunderclouds above its head.
It cheers on friends with pom-poms made of sparks.\nIt drains power from telephone poles.
It absorbs electricity from telephone poles. It shorts\nout its body to create crackling noises.

Plusle always acts as a cheerleader for its partners.
Whenever a teammate puts out a good effort in battle, this
Pokémon shorts out its body to create the crackling noises of
sparks to show its joy.
When Plusle is cheering on its partner, it flashes with electric\nsparks from all over its body. If its partner loses, this Pokémon\ncries loudly.
Exposure to electricity from Minun and Plusle\npromotes blood circulation and relaxes muscles.
It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing,\nits body lets off more and more sparks.
Minun is more concerned about cheering on its partners than\nits own safety. It shorts out the electricity in its body to create\nbrilliant showers of sparks to cheer on its teammates.
Minun loves to cheer on its partner in battle. It gives off sparks\nfrom its body while it is doing so. If its partner is in trouble,\nthis Pokémon gives off increasing amounts of sparks.
It communicates with others by lighting up its rear\nat night. It loves Illumise’s sweet aroma.
It lives around clean ponds. At night, its rear lights\nup. It converses with others by flashing its light.

With the arrival of night, Volbeat emits light from its tail.
It communicates with others by adjusting the intensity and
flashing of its light. This Pokémon is attracted by the sweet
aroma of Illumise.
Volbeat’s tail glows like a lightbulb. With other Volbeat,\nit uses its tail to draw geometric shapes in the night sky.\nThis Pokémon loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.
Its fragrance attracts a swarm of Volbeat, so they\ndraw over 200 patterns in the night sky.
With its sweet aroma, it guides Volbeat to draw\nsigns with light in the night sky.

Illumise attracts a swarm of Volbeat using a sweet fragrance.
Once the Volbeat have gathered, this Pokémon leads the
lit-up swarm in drawing geometric designs on the canvas of
the night sky.
Illumise leads a flight of illuminated Volbeat to draw signs in\nthe night sky. This Pokémon is said to earn greater respect\nfrom its peers by composing more complex designs in the sky.
It uses the different poisons in each hand\nseparately when it attacks. The stronger its aroma,\nthe healthier it is.
Roselia that drink nutritionally rich springwater are\nsaid to reveal rare coloration when they bloom.
Roselia shoots sharp thorns as projectiles at any opponent that\ntries to steal the flowers on its arms. The aroma of this\nPokémon brings serenity to living things.
On extremely rare occasions, a Roselia is said to appear with\nits flowers in unusual colors. The thorns on this Pokémon’s\nhead contain a vicious poison.
It has a small heart and brain. Its stomach\ncomprises most of its body, with enzymes to\ndissolve anything.
There is nothing its stomach can’t digest. While it is\ndigesting, vile, overpowering gases are expelled.
Virtually all of Gulpin’s body is its stomach. As a result, it can\nswallow something its own size. This Pokémon’s stomach\ncontains a special fluid that digests anything.
Most of Gulpin’s body is made up of its stomach—its heart and\nbrain are very small in comparison. This Pokémon’s stomach\ncontains special enzymes that dissolve anything.
It swallows anything whole. It sweats toxic fluids\nfrom its follicles to douse foes.
It gulps anything that fits in its mouth. Its special\nenzymes can dissolve anything.

When Swalot spots prey, it spurts out a hideously toxic fluid
from its pores and sprays the target. Once the prey has
weakened, this Pokémon gulps it down whole with its
cavernous mouth.
Swalot has no teeth, so what it eats, it swallows whole, no\nmatter what. Its cavernous mouth yawns widely. An automobile\ntire could easily fit inside this Pokémon’s mouth.
They form packs to attack boats and rip out their\nhulls to sink them. They live in rivers in the jungle.
It lives in massive rivers that course through\njungles. It swarms prey that enter its territory.
Carvanha’s strongly developed jaws and its sharply pointed\nfangs pack the destructive power to rip out boat hulls.\nMany boats have been attacked and sunk by this Pokémon.
If anything invades Carvanha’s territory, it will swarm and tear\nat the intruder with its pointed fangs. On its own, however, this\nPokémon turns suddenly timid.
Its fangs rip through sheet iron. It swims at 75 mph\nand is known as “The Bully of the Sea.”
It can swim at speeds of 75 mph by jetting\nseawater through its body. It is the bandit of\nthe sea.
Nicknamed “the bully of the sea,” Sharpedo is widely feared.\nIts cruel fangs grow back immediately if they snap off. Just one\nof these Pokémon can thoroughly tear apart a supertanker.
Sharpedo can swim at speeds of up to 75 mph by jetting\nseawater out of its backside. This Pokémon’s drawback is its\ninability to swim long distances.
It bounces playfully like a ball. The more seawater\nit swallows, the higher it bounces.
It eats one ton of food every day. It plays by\nshooting stored seawater out its blowholes with\ngreat force.
Wailmer’s nostrils are located above its eyes. This playful\nPokémon loves to startle people by forcefully snorting out\nseawater it stores inside its body out of its nostrils.

Wailmer can store water inside its body to transform itself
into a ball for bouncing around on the ground. By filling itself
up with more water, this Pokémon can elevate the height of
its bounces.
It can sometimes knock out opponents with the\nshock created by breaching and crashing its big\nbody onto the water.
The biggest of all Pokémon. It can dive to a depth\nof almost 10,000 feet on only one breath.

Wailord is the largest of all identified Pokémon up to now.
This giant Pokémon swims languorously in the vast open sea,
eating massive amounts of food at once with its enormous
mouth.
When chasing prey, Wailord herds them by leaping out of the\nwater and making a humongous splash. It is breathtaking to\nsee this Pokémon leaping out of the sea with others in its pod.
Its humped back stores intensely hot magma.\nIn rain, the magma cools, slowing its movement.
The magma in its body reaches 2,200 degrees\nFahrenheit. Its hump gets smaller when it uses\nFire-type moves.
Numel is extremely dull witted—it doesn’t notice being hit.\nHowever, it can’t stand hunger for even a second.\nThis Pokémon’s body is a seething cauldron of boiling magma.

Numel stores magma of almost 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit
within its body. If it gets wet, the magma cools and hardens.
In that event, the Pokémon’s body grows heavy and its
movements become sluggish.
The volcanoes on its back have a major eruption\nevery 10 years--or whenever it becomes\nreally angry.
If angered, the humps on its back erupt in a shower\nof molten lava. It lives in the craters of volcanoes.

Camerupt has a volcano inside its body. Magma of
18,000 degrees Fahrenheit courses through its body.
Occasionally, the humps on this Pokémon’s back erupt,
spewing the superheated magma.
The humps on Camerupt’s back are formed by a transformation\nof its bones. They sometimes blast out molten magma.\nThis Pokémon apparently erupts often when it is enraged.
You find abandoned coal mines full of them.\nThey dig tirelessly in search of coal.
It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out\nblack soot if it is endangered.

Torkoal digs through mountains in search of coal. If it finds
some, it fills hollow spaces on its shell with the coal and burns
it. If it is attacked, this Pokémon spouts thick black smoke to
beat a retreat.
Torkoal generates energy by burning coal. It grows weaker\nas the fire dies down. When it is preparing for battle, this\nPokémon burns more coal.
It bounces constantly, using its tail like a spring.\nThe shock of bouncing keeps its heart beating.
It bounces around on its tail to keep its\nheart pumping. It carries a pearl from\nClamperl on its head.
Spoink bounces around on its tail. The shock of its bouncing\nmakes its heart pump. As a result, this Pokémon cannot afford\nto stop bouncing—if it stops, its heart will stop.
Spoink keeps a pearl on top of its head. The pearl functions to\namplify this Pokémon’s psychokinetic powers. It is therefore on\na constant search for a bigger pearl.
It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power.\nIt does a strange dance to control foes’ minds.
It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power.\nIt does an odd dance to gain control over foes.

Grumpig uses the black pearls on its body to amplify its
psychic power waves for gaining total control over its foe.
When this Pokémon uses its special power, its snorting breath
grows labored.
Grumpig uses the black pearls on its body to wield\nits fantastic powers. When it is doing so, it dances bizarrely.\nThis Pokémon’s black pearls are valuable as works of art.
No two Spinda have the same pattern of spots.\nIts tottering step fouls the aim of foes.
The chances of two Spinda having identical spot\npatterns is less than one in four billion.
All the Spinda that exist in the world are said to have utterly\nunique spot patterns. The shaky, tottering steps of this\nPokémon give it the appearance of dancing.

No two Spinda are said to have identical spot patterns on their
hides. This Pokémon moves in a curious manner as if it is
stumbling in dizziness. Its lurching movements can cause the
opponent to become confused.
It lives in arid deserts. It makes a sloping pit trap in\nsand where it patiently awaits prey.
It makes an inescapable conical pit and lies in wait\nat the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.
Trapinch’s nest is a sloped, bowl-like pit dug in sand.\nThis Pokémon patiently waits for prey to tumble down the pit.\nIts giant jaws have enough strength to crush even boulders.
Trapinch is a patient hunter. It digs an inescapable pit in a\ndesert and waits for its prey to come tumbling down. This\nPokémon can go a whole week without access to any water.
The ultrasonic waves it generates by rubbing its two\nwings together cause severe headaches.
It generates ultrasonic waves by violently flapping\nits wings. After making its prey faint, it melts the\nprey with acid.

To make prey faint, Vibrava generates ultrasonic waves by
vigorously making its two wings vibrate. This Pokémon’s
ultrasonic waves are so powerful, they can bring on headaches
in people.
Vibrava’s wings have not yet completed the process of\ngrowing. Rather than flying long distances, they are more\nuseful for generating ultrasonic waves by vibrating.
It hides itself by kicking up desert sand with its\nwings. Red covers shield its eyes from sand.
Known as “The Desert Spirit,” this Pokémon hides in\nthe sandstorms it causes by beating its wings.
Flygon is nicknamed “the elemental spirit of the desert.”\nBecause its flapping wings whip up a cloud of sand, this\nPokémon is always enveloped in a sandstorm while flying.

Flygon whips up a sandstorm by flapping its wings. The wings
create a series of notes that sound like singing. Because the
“singing” is the only thing that can be heard in a sandstorm,
this Pokémon is said to be the desert spirit.
It lives in arid locations. Its yellow flowers bloom\nonce a year.
It prefers harsh environments such as deserts.\nIt can survive for 30 days on water stored in\nits body.

Cacnea lives in arid locations such as deserts. It releases a
strong aroma from its flower to attract prey. When prey comes
near, this Pokémon shoots sharp thorns from its body to bring
the victim down.
The more arid and harsh the environment, the more pretty and\nfragrant a flower Cacnea grows. This Pokémon battles by\nwildly swinging its thorny arms.
It becomes active at night, seeking prey that is\nexhausted from the day’s desert heat.
Packs of them follow travelers through the desert\nuntil the travelers can no longer move.
During the daytime, Cacturne remains unmoving so that it does\nnot lose any moisture to the harsh desert sun. This Pokémon\nbecomes active at night when the temperature drops.

If a traveler is going through a desert in the thick of night,
Cacturne will follow in a ragtag group. The Pokémon are
biding their time, waiting for the traveler to tire and become
incapable of moving.
For some reason, it likes to land on people’s heads\nsoftly and act like it’s a hat.
It constantly grooms its cotton-like wings. It takes\na shower to clean itself if it becomes dirty.
Swablu has light and fluffy wings that are like cottony clouds.\nThis Pokémon is not frightened of people. It lands on the\nheads of people and sits there like a cotton-fluff hat.
Swablu loves to make things clean. If it spots something dirty,\nit will wipe and polish it with its cottony wings. If its wings\nbecome dirty, this Pokémon finds a stream and showers itself.
It flies gracefully through the sky. Its melodic\nhumming makes you feel like you’re in a dream.
On sunny days, it flies freely through the sky and\nblends into the clouds. It sings in a\nbeautiful soprano.

Altaria dances and wheels through the sky among billowing,
cotton-like clouds. By singing melodies in its crystal-clear
voice, this Pokémon makes its listeners experience dreamy
wonderment.
Altaria sings in a gorgeous soprano. Its wings are like cotton\nclouds. This Pokémon catches updrafts with its buoyant wings\nand soars way up into the wild blue yonder.
It has feuded with Seviper for many generations.\nIts sharp claws are its biggest weapons.
Its fur would all stand on end if it smelled a Seviper\nnearby. Its sharp claws tear up its foes.
Memories of battling its archrival Seviper are etched into every\ncell of Zangoose’s body. This Pokémon adroitly dodges\nattacks with incredible agility.
Zangoose usually stays on all fours, but when angered, it gets\nup on its hind legs and extends its claws. This Pokémon shares\na bitter rivalry with Seviper that dates back over generations.
In battle, it uses its bladed tail to counter any\nZangoose. It secretes a deadly venom in its tail.
Constant polishing makes the edge of the blade on\nits tail extremely sharp. It’s Zangoose’s archrival.
Seviper shares a generations-long feud with Zangoose.\nThe scars on its body are evidence of vicious battles.\nThis Pokémon attacks using its sword-edged tail.
Seviper’s swordlike tail serves two purposes—it slashes foes\nand douses them with secreted poison. This Pokémon will not\ngive up its long-running blood feud with Zangoose.
Because it turns active on nights of the full moon,\nit is said to have some link to the lunar phases.
It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike\n40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.

Lunatone was discovered at a location where a meteoroid fell.
As a result, some people theorize that this Pokémon came
from space. However, no one has been able to prove this
theory so far.

Lunatone becomes active around the time of the full moon.
Instead of walking, it moves by floating in midair.
The Pokémon’s intimidating red eyes cause all those who
see it to become transfixed with fear.
Solar energy is the source of its power,\nso it is strong during the daytime.\nWhen it spins, its body shines.
It absorbs solar energy during the day. Always\nexpressionless, it can sense what its foe is thinking.
Solrock is a new species of Pokémon that is said to have fallen\nfrom space. It floats in air and moves silently. In battle, this\nPokémon releases intensely bright light.
Sunlight is the source of Solrock’s power. It is said to possess\nthe ability to read the emotions of others. This Pokémon gives\noff intense heat while rotating its body.
It coats its entire body with a slimy fluid so it can\nsquirm and slip away if grabbed.
Its whiskers make a superb radar. They are used to\nlocate prey, even in the murkiest of water.
Barboach’s sensitive whiskers serve as a superb radar system.\nThis Pokémon hides in mud, leaving only its two whiskers\nexposed while it waits for prey to come along.
Barboach’s body is covered with a slimy film. If a foe grabs it,\nthis Pokémon just slips out of the enemy’s grip. This Pokémon\ngrows weak if the slimy coating dries up.
It claims a large swamp to itself. If a foe comes\nnear it, it sets off tremors by thrashing around.
It makes its nest at the bottom of swamps.\nIt will eat anything--if it is alive, Whiscash will eat it.

Whiscash is extremely territorial. Just one of these Pokémon
will claim a large pond as its exclusive territory. If a foe
approaches it, it thrashes about and triggers a massive
earthquake.
If Whiscash goes on a wild rampage, it sets off a quake-like\ntremor with a radius of over three miles. This Pokémon has\nthe ability to predict real earthquakes.
No matter how dirty the water in the river, it will\nadapt and thrive. It has a strong will to survive.
Its hardy vitality enables it to adapt to any\nenvironment. Its pincers will never release prey.
Corphish were originally foreign Pokémon that were imported\nas pets. They eventually turned up in the wild. This Pokémon is\nvery hardy and has greatly increased its population.
Corphish catches prey with its sharp claws. It has no\nlikes or dislikes when it comes to food—it will eat anything.\nThis Pokémon has no trouble living in filthy water.
It is a ruffian that uses its pincers to pick up and\ntoss out other Pokémon from its pond.
Loving to battle, this Pokémon pinches all Pokémon\nthat enter its territory with its pincers and throws\nthem out.

Crawdaunt has an extremely violent nature that compels it to
challenge other living things to battle. Other life-forms refuse
to live in ponds inhabited by this Pokémon, making them
desolate places.

Crawdaunt molts (sheds) its shell regularly. Immediately after
molting, its shell is soft and tender. Until the shell hardens,
this Pokémon hides in its streambed burrow to avoid attack
from its foes.
It moves while spinning around on its single foot.\nSome Baltoy have been seen spinning on\ntheir heads.
It moves by spinning on its foot. It is a rare\nPokémon that was discovered in ancient ruins.
Baltoy moves while spinning around on its one foot. Primitive\nwall paintings depicting this Pokémon living among people\nwere discovered in some ancient ruins.
As soon as it spots others of its kind, Baltoy congregates with\nthem and then begins crying noisily in unison. This Pokémon\nsleeps while cleverly balancing itself on its one foot.
An ancient clay figurine that came to life as a\nPokémon from exposure to a mysterious ray\nof light.
It is said that it originates from clay dolls made by\nan ancient civilization.
Claydol are said to be dolls of mud made by primitive humans\nand brought to life by exposure to a mysterious ray.\nThis Pokémon moves about while levitating.
Claydol is an enigma that appeared from a clay statue made by\nan ancient civilization dating back 20,000 years. This Pokémon\nshoots beams from both its hands.
It disguises its tentacles as flowers to attract and\ncatch prey. It became extinct in ancient times.
It lived on the seafloor 100 million years ago and\nwas reanimated scientifically.

Lileep became extinct approximately a hundred million years
ago. This ancient Pokémon attaches itself to a rock on the
seafloor and catches approaching prey using tentacles shaped
like flower petals.

Lileep is an ancient Pokémon that was regenerated from a
fossil. It remains permanently anchored to a rock. From its
immobile perch, this Pokémon intently scans for prey with its
two eyes.
It lives in the shallows of warm seas. When the tide\ngoes out, it digs up prey from beaches.
It ensnares prey with its eight tentacles. It then\nmelts the prey with a strong acid before feeding.
Cradily roams around the ocean floor in search of food.\nThis Pokémon freely extends its tree trunk-like neck and\ncaptures unwary prey using its eight tentacles.
Cradily’s body serves as an anchor, preventing it from being\nwashed away in rough seas. This Pokémon secretes a strong\ndigestive fluid from its tentacles.
It is a kind of Pokémon progenitor. It uses its\nextending claws to catch prey hiding among rocks\non the seafloor.
A Pokémon ancestor that was reanimated from a\nfossil. It lived in the sea and hunted with claws.
Anorith was regenerated from a prehistoric fossil. This primitive\nPokémon once lived in warm seas. It grips its prey firmly\nbetween its two large claws.
Anorith is said to be a type of Pokémon predecessor, with\neight wings at the sides of its body. This Pokémon swam in the\nprimordial sea by undulating these eight wings.
Its enormous, retractable claws can cut through\nmost anything. Its entire body is clad in\nsturdy plates.
Protected by a hard shell, its body is very sturdy.\nIt skewers prey with its claws to feed.

Armaldo’s tough armor makes all attacks bounce off. This
Pokémon’s two enormous claws can be freely extended or
contracted. They have the power to punch right through a
steel slab.

Armaldo is a Pokémon species that became extinct in
prehistoric times. This Pokémon is said to have walked
on its hind legs, which would have been more convenient
for life on land.
It eats anything, so it can even live in polluted\nstreams and lakes. No one pays any attention to it.
It is the shabbiest Pokémon of all. It forms in\nschools and lives at the bottom of rivers.
Feebas’s fins are ragged and tattered from the start of its life.\nBecause of its shoddy appearance, this Pokémon is largely\nignored. It is capable of living in both the sea and in rivers.
While Feebas’s body is in tatters, it has a hardy and tenacious\nlife force that enables it to live anywhere. However, this\nPokémon is also slow and dimwitted, making it an easy catch.
Milotic is breathtakingly beautiful. Those that see it\nare said to forget their combative spirits.
It is the world’s most beautiful Pokémon. There are\nmany works of art featuring Milotic.
Milotic is said to be the most beautiful of all the Pokémon.\nIt has the power to becalm such emotions as anger and\nhostility to quell bitter feuding.
Milotic live at the bottom of large lakes. When this\nPokémon’s body glows a vivid pink, it releases a pulsing\nwave of energy that brings soothing calm to troubled hearts.
This Pokémon can change its cells, taking different\nforms based on the temperature and humidity.
It has the ability to change its form into the sun,\nthe rain, or a snow cloud, depending on\nthe weather.
Castform’s appearance changes with the weather.\nThis Pokémon gained the ability to use the vast power of\nnature to protect its tiny body.
Castform borrows the power of nature to transform itself\ninto the guises of the sun, rain, and snow-clouds.\nThis Pokémon’s feelings change with the weather.
It can freely change its body’s color. The zigzag\npattern on its belly doesn’t change, however.
It changes its shading to match its surroundings\nso it can sneak up on prey. Only its belly patterns\nstay fixed.
Kecleon is capable of changing its body colors at will to blend\nin with its surroundings. There is one exception—this Pokémon\ncan’t change the zigzag pattern on its belly.

Kecleon alters its body coloration to blend in with its
surroundings, allowing it to sneak up on its prey unnoticed.
Then it lashes out with its long, stretchy tongue to instantly
ensnare the unsuspecting target.
It uses its horn to feed on envy and malice--\nor so it’s said. It’s very active at night.
It loves vengeful emotions and hangs in rows under\nthe eaves of houses where vengeful people live.

Shuppet is attracted by feelings of jealousy and vindictiveness.
If someone develops strong feelings of vengeance, this
Pokémon will appear in a swarm and line up beneath the eaves
of that person’s home.
Shuppet grows by feeding on dark emotions, such as\nvengefulness and envy, in the hearts of people. It roams\nthrough cities in search of grudges that taint people.
A doll that became a Pokémon over its grudge from\nbeing junked. It seeks the child that disowned it.
Strong feelings of hatred turned a puppet into a\nPokémon. If it opens its mouth, its cursed\nenergy escapes.
Banette generates energy for laying strong curses by sticking\npins into its own body. This Pokémon was originally a pitiful\nplush doll that was thrown away.

A cursed energy permeated the stuffing of a discarded and
forgotten plush doll, giving it new life as Banette.
The Pokémon’s energy would escape if it were to ever open
its mouth.
It doggedly pursues its prey wherever it goes.\nHowever, the chase is abandoned at sunrise.
If it finds bad children who won’t listen to their\nparents, it will spirit them away--or so it’s said.
Duskull can pass through any wall no matter how thick it may\nbe. Once this Pokémon chooses a target, it will doggedly\npursue the intended victim until the break of dawn.

Duskull wanders lost among the deep darkness of midnight.
There is an oft-told admonishment given to misbehaving
children that this Pokémon will spirit away bad children who
earn scoldings from their mothers.
Anyone who dares peer into its body to see its\nspectral ball of fire will have their spirit stolen away.
Its body is hollow. It is said that those who look\ninto its body are sucked into the void.

Dusclops’s body is completely hollow—there is nothing at all
inside. It is said that its body is like a black hole. This
Pokémon will absorb anything into its body, but nothing will
ever come back out.

Dusclops absorbs anything, however large the object may be.
This Pokémon hypnotizes its foe by waving its hands in a
macabre manner and by bringing its single eye to bear.
The hypnotized foe is made to do Dusclops’s bidding.
It flies by flapping its broad leaves and gives\nthe sweet, delicious fruit around its neck\nto children.
The bunch of fruit around its neck ripens twice a\nyear and is delicious. It’s a highly favored\ntropical snack.

The bunches of fruit around Tropius’s neck are very popular
with children. This Pokémon loves fruit, and eats it
continuously. Apparently, its love for fruit resulted in its own
outgrowth of fruit.
Children of the southern tropics eat as snacks the fruit that\ngrows in bunches around the neck of Tropius. This Pokémon\nflies by flapping the leaves on its back as if they were wings.
It uses the sucker on its head to hang from a tree\nor from eaves. It can produce seven different tones.
Emitting ultrasonic cries, it floats on winds to travel\ngreat distances.
Chimecho makes its cries echo inside its hollow body.\nWhen this Pokémon becomes enraged, its cries result in\nultrasonic waves that have the power to knock foes flying.
In high winds, Chimecho cries as it hangs from a tree branch or\nthe eaves of a building using a suction cup on its head. This\nPokémon plucks berries with its long tail and eats them.
It senses coming disasters and appears before\npeople only to warn them of impending danger.
It appears when it senses an impending natural\ndisaster. As a result, it was mistaken as a\ndoom bringer.
Every time Absol appears before people, it is followed by a\ndisaster such as an earthquake or a tidal wave. As a result,\nit came to be known as the disaster Pokémon.
Absol has the ability to foretell the coming of natural disasters.\nIt lives in a harsh, rugged mountain environment. This\nPokémon very rarely ventures down from the mountains.
It tends to move in a pack with others. They cluster\nin a tight group to sleep in a cave.
It grows strong by pushing up against others en\nmasse. It loves eating sweet fruit.
Wynaut can always be seen with a big, happy smile on its face.\nLook at its tail to determine if it is angry. When angered, this\nPokémon will be slapping the ground with its tail.
Wynaut gather on moonlit nights to play by squeezing up\nagainst each other. By being squeezed, this Pokémon gains\nendurance and is trained to dole out powerful counterattacks.
It is said that several Snorunt gather under giant\nleaves and live together in harmony.
In the snow country, certain folklore says a house\nwill prosper if a Snorunt lives there.

Snorunt live in regions with heavy snowfall. In seasons

Snorunt survives by eating only snow and ice. Old folklore\nclaims that a house visited by this Pokémon is sure to prosper\nfor many generations to come.
To protect itself, it clad its body in an armor of ice,\nmade by freezing moisture in the air.
It can instantly freeze moisture in the atmosphere.\nIt uses this power to freeze its foes.

Glalie has the ability to freely control ice. For example, it can\ninstantly freeze its prey solid. After immobilizing its prey in ice,\nthis Pokémon enjoys eating it in leisurely fashion.
They can’t swim well yet, and they move much\nfaster by rolling. When they’re happy, they\nclap fins.

Its well-developed neck muscles and iron-like\nhead can smash boulders into pieces.

With its Herculean powers, it can easily throw\naround an object that is 100 times its own weight.

Heracross charges in a straight line at its foe, slips beneath the
foe’s grasp, and then scoops up and hurls the opponent with
its mighty horn. This Pokémon even has enough power to
topple a massive tree.

Heracross has sharp claws on its feet. These are planted
firmly into the ground or the bark of a tree, giving the
Pokémon a secure and solid footing to forcefully fling away
foes with its proud horn.
Long ago, people imagined its eerie howls to be\nthe call of the grim reaper.
The flames it breathes when angry contain toxins.\nIf they cause a burn, it will hurt forever.
In a Houndoom pack, the one with its horns raked sharply\ntoward the back serves a leadership role. These Pokémon\nchoose their leader by fighting among themselves.
In a Houndoom pack, the one with its horns raked sharply\ntoward the back serves a leadership role. These Pokémon\nchoose their leader by fighting among themselves.
In just one of its mighty hands, it has the power to\nmake the ground shake and mountains crumble.
If it rampages, it knocks down mountains and buries\nrivers. Maps must be redrawn afterward.
Tyranitar is so overwhelmingly powerful, it can bring down a\nwhole mountain to make its nest. This Pokémon wanders about\nin mountains seeking new opponents to fight.
Tyranitar is so overwhelmingly powerful, it can bring down a\nwhole mountain to make its nest. This Pokémon wanders about\nin mountains seeking new opponents to fight.
It can clear a 30-story building in a leap.\nIts fiery punches scorch its foes.
When facing a tough foe, it looses flames from\nits wrists. Its powerful legs let it jump clear\nover buildings.
In battle, Blaziken blows out intense flames from its wrists and\nattacks foes courageously. The stronger the foe, the more\nintensely this Pokémon’s wrists burn.
Blaziken has incredibly strong legs—it can easily clear a\n30-story building in one leap. This Pokémon’s blazing punches\nleave its foes scorched and blackened.
To protect its Trainer, it will expend all its psychic\npower to create a small black hole.
It has the power to predict the future. Its power\npeaks when it is protecting its Trainer.
Gardevoir has the ability to read the future. If it senses\nimpending danger to its Trainer, this Pokémon is said\nto unleash its psychokinetic energy at full power.
Gardevoir has the psychokinetic power to distort the\ndimensions and create a small black hole. This Pokémon\nwill try to protect its Trainer even at the risk of its own life.
It uses its docile-looking face to lull foes into\ncomplacency, then bites with its huge,\nrelentless jaws.
Attached to its head is a huge set of jaws formed\nby horns. It can chew through iron beams.

Mawile’s huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been
transformed. Its docile-looking face serves to lull its foe into
letting down its guard. When the foe least expects it, Mawile
chomps it with its gaping jaws.

Don’t be taken in by this Pokémon’s cute face—it’s very
dangerous. Mawile fools the foe into letting down its guard,
then chomps down with its massive jaws. The steel jaws are
really horns that have been transformed.
It claims an entire mountain as its own.\nThe more wounds it has, the more it has battled,\nso don’t take it lightly.
While seeking iron for food, it digs tunnels by\nbreaking through bedrock with its steel horns.
Aggron claims an entire mountain as its own territory.\nIt mercilessly beats up anything that violates its environment.\nThis Pokémon vigilantly patrols its territory at all times.

Aggron is protective of its environment. If its mountain is
ravaged by a landslide or a fire, this Pokémon will haul
topsoil to the area, plant trees, and beautifully restore its
own territory.
It elegantly avoids attacks with dance-like steps,\nthen launches a devastating blow in the\nsame motion.
Through yoga training, it gained the psychic power\nto predict its foe’s next move.
It is said that through meditation, Medicham heightens energy\ninside its body and sharpens its sixth sense. This Pokémon\nhides its presence by merging itself with fields and mountains.

Through the power of meditation, Medicham developed its
sixth sense. It gained the ability to use psychokinetic powers.
This Pokémon is known to meditate for a whole month
without eating.
It rarely appears before people. It is said to nest\nwhere lightning has fallen.
It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a\nthundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.
Manectric is constantly discharging electricity from its mane.\nThe sparks sometimes ignite forest fires. When it enters a\nbattle, this Pokémon creates thunderclouds.
Manectric discharges strong electricity from its mane.\nThe mane is used for collecting electricity in the atmosphere.\nThis Pokémon creates thunderclouds above its head.
A doll that became a Pokémon over its grudge from\nbeing junked. It seeks the child that disowned it.
Strong feelings of hatred turned a puppet into a\nPokémon. If it opens its mouth, its cursed\nenergy escapes.
Banette generates energy for laying strong curses by sticking\npins into its own body. This Pokémon was originally a pitiful\nplush doll that was thrown away.

A cursed energy permeated the stuffing of a discarded and
forgotten plush doll, giving it new life as Banette.
The Pokémon’s energy would escape if it were to ever open
its mouth.
It senses coming disasters and appears before\npeople only to warn them of impending danger.
It appears when it senses an impending natural\ndisaster. As a result, it was mistaken as a\ndoom bringer.
Every time Absol appears before people, it is followed by a\ndisaster such as an earthquake or a tidal wave. As a result,\nit came to be known as the disaster Pokémon.
Absol has the ability to foretell the coming of natural disasters.\nIt lives in a harsh, rugged mountain environment. This\nPokémon very rarely ventures down from the mountains.
It communicates using telepathy. Its body is\ncovered in down that refracts light to make\nit invisible.
It can telepathically communicate with people. It\nchanges its appearance using its down that\nrefracts light.
Latias is highly sensitive to the emotions of people. If it senses\nany hostility, this Pokémon ruffles the feathers all over its body\nand cries shrilly to intimidate the foe.

Latias is highly intelligent and capable of understanding
human speech. It is covered with a glass-like down.
The Pokémon enfolds its body with its down and refracts
light to alter its appearance.
A highly intelligent Pokémon. By folding back its\nwings in flight, it can overtake jet planes.
It understands human speech and is highly\nintelligent. It is a tender Pokémon that\ndislikes fighting.
Latios has the ability to make others see an image of what it\nhas seen or imagines in its head. This Pokémon is intelligent\nand understands human speech.
Latios will only open its heart to a Trainer with a\ncompassionate spirit. This Pokémon can fly faster than a\njet plane by folding its forelegs to minimize air resistance.
When it folds up its body and extends its wings,\nit looks like a jet plane. It flies at sonic speed.
It flies at speeds equal to a jet fighter plane.\nIt never allows its prey to escape.
When it folds up its body and extends its wings,\nit looks like a jet plane. It flies at sonic speed.
It flies at speeds equal to a jet fighter plane.\nIt never allows its prey to escape.
By catching the aura emanating from others, it can\nread their thoughts and movements.
By reading the auras of all things, it can tell how\nothers are feeling from over half a mile away.
By catching the aura emanating from others, it can\nread their thoughts and movements.
By reading the auras of all things, it can tell how\nothers are feeling from over half a mile away.
It blankets wide areas in snow by whipping up\nblizzards. It is also known as “The Ice Monster.”
It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually\ncovered in snow. It hides itself by whipping\nup blizzards.
It blankets wide areas in snow by whipping up\nblizzards. It is also known as “The Ice Monster.”
It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually\ncovered in snow. It hides itself by whipping\nup blizzards.
According to the legends of Sinnoh, this Pokémon\nemerged from an egg and shaped all there is in\nthis world.
It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born\nbefore the universe even existed.

It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born\nbefore the universe even existed.
It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for\nflowers that are starting to wilt. It draws\nout the hidden power of flowers to battle.
When the flowers of a well-tended flower bed bloom,\nit appears and celebrates with an elegant dance.
It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for\nflowers that are starting to wilt. It draws\nout the hidden power of flowers to battle.
When the flowers of a well-tended flower bed bloom,\nit appears and celebrates with an elegant dance.
When in danger, it raises its ears and\nreleases enough psychic power to\ngrind a 10-ton truck into dust.
The eyeball patterns on the interior of its ears\nemit psychic energy. It keeps the patterns tightly\ncovered because that power is too immense.
When in danger, it raises its ears and\nreleases enough psychic power to\ngrind a 10-ton truck into dust.
The eyeball patterns on the interior of its ears\nemit psychic energy. It keeps the patterns tightly\ncovered because that power is too immense.
Generations of kings were attended by these\nPokémon, which used their spectral power to\nmanipulate and control people and Pokémon.
Apparently, it can detect the innate qualities\nof leadership. According to legend, whoever it\nrecognizes is destined to become king.

Apparently, it can detect the innate qualities\nof leadership. According to legend, whoever it\nrecognizes is destined to become king.
The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit\ntrapped in this world. As the sun sets,\nit becomes restless and active.
It is said to carry wandering spirits\nto the place where they belong\nso they can move on.

Singing in eerie voices, they wander\ntown streets on the night of the new moon.\nAnyone who hears their song is cursed.
It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms.\nIt sings joyfully as it observes the\nsuffering of its prey.

Beedrill is extremely territorial. No one should ever approach\nits nest—this is for their own safety. If angered, they will attack\nin a furious swarm.
Beedrill is extremely territorial. No one should ever approach\nits nest—this is for their own safety. If angered, they will attack\nin a furious swarm.

This Pokémon has a dazzling plumage of beautifully
glossy feathers. Many Trainers are captivated by the
striking beauty of the feathers on its head, compelling
them to choose Pidgeot as their Pokémon.

striking beauty of the feathers on its head, compelling
them to choose Pidgeot as their Pokémon.

Whenever Pikachu comes across something new,
it blasts it with a jolt of electricity. If you come across a
blackened berry, it’s evidence that this Pokémon mistook the
intensity of its charge.

This Pokémon has electricity-storing pouches on its cheeks.
These appear to become electrically charged during the night
while Pikachu sleeps. It occasionally discharges electricity
when it is dozy after waking up.
